review: I love Friday's, but I must say, this 3rd time is my fault again. Around a year ago I came here for the first time, It was not great. The 2nd time with my brother, as well blah. I again returned due to it being close to home and not wanting to commute further on 287, and it was ridiculous. The food was cold, the waiter was horrible, and they were not even busy. Thank God it's just this Friday's. I will stick to going to the one in the North Bronx or even as far as Queens.

I'm sorry but automatically any large food chain establishment gets three stars from me.  In all my years, I haven't find one that had me at "OMG this was fabulous service and food" but just more of, "it filled me up and I can sleep peacefully now".  I went to eat at Fridays with some co-workers and was able to split the Jack Daniels sampler (Crispy Cajun shrimp, Asian-inspired Sesame Jack Chicken Strips and Jack Daniel's® glazed baby back pork ribs).  I do have to admit that their Jack Daniel's selection is pretty good.   I even ordered their Jack Daniel's salmon with a side of mashed because I felt I had enough meat.  It was happy with it considering it a food chain, and on the well done side but I wouldn't expect Friday's to know how to cook salmon correctly anyway. It's tough in general.   The waitress was good.  Very attentive and concerned for my well being and asked if I was driving when I asked for a stronger drink as a second.  Obviously, she doesn't know who I am so I told her I was a veteran.  I doubt Friday's drink could even give me a slight buzz, which it didn't. Ohhh, lightweights.   Anyway, go for the Jack Daniel's selection. You won't be disappointed.
unbelievable. Stupid waiter took 40 dollars from us and charged us the whole amount on the credit card. Dont go here. dont trust the pople.

I haven't been to TGI-F in a very long time, It terns out that food has gotten better and service have improved.  You should check this out for yourself.  great place for family dinner I think \. and price is right !

One word: GHETTO! You hear the workers cursing and shouting "fuck this, shit that, nigga nigga nigga,blap blap blap!", ya know, the typical way blacks and hispanics talk: absolutely vulgar! The waitress didn't seem like she cared about anything. I have long hair so she mistook me for a chick and she never ever apologized. Typical. Blacks and hispanics don't apologize for anything. So fucking rude and unprofessional that whole place is. Of course you always get the classic ghetto staring contest as well. You know what I mean "What choo lookin' at, you long haired cracka?!" Like my friends father who's Puerto Rican said "Where there's caucasian, there's quality." So true. Maybe other people don't mind this treatment, but I'm from the Bronx, and I had to put up with this shit my whole life, so after a while, it gets kinda old. Also, I'm half Rican myself, just to let anybody who reads this know. Anyways, I will recommend this place to no one except for other ghetto people. It wouldn't surprise me if they spit in our food. I hope this place gets hit by a meteor, with all the workers in it, leaving nothing but a giant crater! Ghetto people ruin everything! They should call this place WOODLANDS THE RESTAURANT! Anybody who went to woodlands high school or knows about it's reputation, will understand exactly what I mean when you walk in to friday's. TGIF stands for the ignorant ghetto fucks!

Ok so not many things are perfect, but come on at least something on the menu should be tasty. The service was great, but the food had me wanting to leave after discovering the mozzarella sticks were horrible.  I wouldn't come back to this location if someone was paying, no thank you.

The new mozarella sticks suck! We were told that they were a mix of mozarella cheese and some other cheese that apparently doesnt melt too well and tastes dry.. Yuk.  Last time we went there our server was horrible.. He brought the food and left quickly. We had to look for someone to get us utensils and napkins. Arent the utensils the first things to go on the table? ;-/
Best happy hr spot! The bartenders are cool the girls are nice just great spot. N Thursdays!!

My Family and I had a great time .. So it's 4 star for me. I Decided to come here since it's been awhile since we had dined here. Well as we come in the staff opened the doors for us and greeted us with a smile that was an impeccable manner. We were seated and been served as expected..  Situated in Greenville Center, you wouldn't expect it to be big. The place is huge inside  , neat and clean. We live close by to another and new TGIF chain but this was the right place. The food isn't pricey at all.. Absolutely tasty and filling. A Plus, they send you coupons privately ..  Their bartenders are great in mixing drinks. The staff are all friendly and our server was excellent.. Very efficient. Parking is always crowded tho but a lot of spaces supposedly. Well we came at the right time so it wasn't a hassle for us. On a fri nite.. Here, my family and I had fun, great moments all together, good dinner.. Excellent people around. Greatly satisfied. Will recommend to people and surely will be back for more. Thanks... Impressive!

Don't waste your time or money. The last time I went (and I will NEVER be back), not only was our waitress incredibly rude and snotty, but I also got food poisoning. If you want Fridays, take a ride up to the one in Tarrytown.

Terrible service. Especially for large groups. I'm literally writing this as I wait for the manager to "fix" our bill. We've been here for almost 3 hours with a group of 12 people (3 of which are kids and are already falling asleep at the table from the ridiculous amount of time we've been here. Needless to say we will NOT be returning to this TGI location

I enjoy tgif always have. but Nunu Yes that nunu Is never happy whenever he orders a beer he always bitches that the beer is flat always .he only orders the ribs which he enjoys wow my buddy PORCELLI sucks everything he orders down to the bone but always says it's just ok.but what I don't understand is that he complains that he can not taste the food. However he sucks it all up.  For me I like the food and prices and will always come back
New menu, higher prices, smaller servings, loud music, lousy food. Will never return.  Can't post a review unless you include at least one star otherwise if I could they would have gotten 0 stars.
I don't understand the bad reviews. I've only had good meals here. Very good. Whenever I order a steak it's cooked perfectly and it tastes delicious. The sides are tasty also.

There are the when you want a good drinks and food But this was not the intended time for us. The drinks were water down and we were afraid to eat the food. I hope they get better because we like Friday's
Food was good and service was efficient!  However, the waitress with short blond hair wasn't very friendly!  At one point she slammed down a drink on the table!

I wish i could give 0 stars. First off the waiter was never around. Secondly he didn't bring out the appetizers until our dinner was ready. We had to clear out own table (aka move empty plates to the surrounding tables) so we could eat. Then he got our orders wrong. And to make matters worse, I signed my credit slip to charge me $39, and they charged me $60.  Please stay away from this place. I have never had such terrible service before, and I usually give the benefit of the doubt but the place was empty and we were the only people in this section (at 8:30pm on a saturday). That should have given me the first red flag.

Food is good service SUCKS! First, went to the bathroom and a server was in the bathroom as well fixing herself has her Uggs boots on the counter sink. Didn't even take it down on the floor when I needed to use the sink.  Gave us our food and asked us if we want silverware. Really? The wait to be served is unacceptable. Had to wait for the waiter to take our orders.

What is it with this location? The food is good, but the service is horrendous and has been going down hill for a while. The server disappeared completely after serving the food, even though the place was half empty, and a few items were wrong. The passion fruit - strawberry drink was like water, but even if we wanted to order a refill, we had no way to. My steak was raw (ordered medium rare), Got the wrong tea even after repeating it twice for the server. This individual was friendly and trying hard, but needed some assistance.    And to add insult to injury the ladies restroom was a pig sty, with no toilet paper in the handicap stall and urine on the seats.     This was my last foray into Scarsdale's TGIF. I've been going there for years, but will now stick with Tarrytown.

We haven't been here in several years because the food was not that great. We were hoping things changed. We ordered the Fridays Shrimp and the Classic Cheeseburger The menu has not changed at all in all these years. The Fridays Shrimp was unevenly salted. The shrimp and the top fries were heavily salted and the bottom fries had no salt at all. The Classic Cheeseburger was okay except they gave me so few fries. I got the same amount of fries a kid gets from a McDonalds' Happy Meal. My burger was cooked to the right temperature. Our server was friendly and no complaints.

So I went to this piece of crap restaurant and behold it did not let me down. The food gave me diarrhea and the waiter was flirting with my wife. I was like, "Dude, really?" So the food comes out and it was cold. The eating utensils were dirty with food stuck on it. I asked the pervert waiter to change it and he brought another pair of utensils that were worst. My wife and I picked up and left. Never again shall we set foot in that place.

I will never come to this location ever again. Sat for I can't even express how long before we got our drinks. Our waitress was flighty. Half my party ate before we even got our food AND the bread on my sandwich was ROCK HARD! The service is terrible it's more of a social event for this place then working and service. Being in the service industry it offends me beyond the point of return. NEVER AGAIN

Today I went in for some drinks. Our server was very nice. I went in with my dad and boyfriend. They ordered two long islands . The drinks were great . Strong and tasty. They had a second round but the second round did not have a hint of alcohol.  For dinner I debated ordering the chicken fettuccine bc it was spicy which I don't like.  Our server noticed and asked if I wanted it on the side, which was perfect . So he saved the day. It was very tasty and it came at the right temperature.  There is a parking lot and there was no wait .

Worst experience ever. I wish i could give them zero star for their service yesterday. our server was never around. Our cups was really dirty. They did not even offer us to bring out water. The staffs were loud and playing around near the entrance. I will never go back to this place to dine in.

I went here on a Saturday, 2/7/2015, and it was an okay experience. There was a 5-10 minute waiting period before we were seated by the hostess. Our server, Jeff, was very attentive to us before and during our meal. We chose the Friday's Pick Three-For-All as our appetizer. We had a choice between boneless or traditional wings. Of course we picked the boneless option. Who wants to make things hard when they can be so easy? Crispy green bean fries and mozzarella sticks were our choices as well. Celery sticks also came in the appetizer, 6 to be exact. Everything was delicious but I didn't care too much for the dipping sauces. I usually order my favorite entree, Cajun shrimp & chicken pasta, but I decided to try something different. After seeing a photo of the sizzling chicken & shrimp entree, I couldn't contain the curiosity of my taste buds. My guy also raved about how delicious it is, as did Jeff. I was sold from the moment my guy told me to try it because I know he likes the best. To have more than 1 person telling me about the dish, as I just said...SOLD!!! Let's just say that although it wasn't disgusting or nasty, I won't be ordering it again. I love shrimp just as much as any other individual who's fortunate to not be allergic to it, but it's seasoned better in the dish I usually order. The chicken was mucho perfecto and the melted cheese under the onions, peppers, and creamy mashed potatoes didn't taste bad. It's just not as good as my usual. Don't take my word for it. Try it out anyway. Different people like different things. I just chose to drink the free water as my beverage choice. I did indulge in a dessert for my sweet tooth, couldn't resist. The vanilla bean cheesecake is to die for!!!
Not consistent food or service. Sometimes a five others A one. Consistent is key.Today I was there for lunch wait was a bit extensive. That was bad enough but my food was wrong.
Thank God its a Monday!!! I just came here for some drinks.., but unfortunately no MUSIC., even for St Patricks day!! Otherwise there food is good, service is excellent..

Omg came her for endless apps...tgif needs to rename this " endless wait "4 appys.   Waitress was super nice but was never around! Kinda threatened her and said don't walk through your section without food anymore!!! Started laughing with a neighboring table then we noticed all the blank stares and upside down mouths. .no one had food! This place is a freak show..no bus boys either. Food was decent chain stuff but lack of anything to eat for 30 minute clips.... unacceptable!!!!

I wish I could give 0 stars! This Friday's has to have the WORST service I have ever seen. The place was empty when we first walked in. It took about 10 mins for someone to come over to us. Finally our drinks and food orders were taken at the same time. 20 mins later we asked about where our drinks were. We were first told "the bartender is busy" then we asked again and the waitress tells us "the bartender has her own tables." We finally get our food, things were missing. Never received an "I'm sorry" or never saw a manager. This is my 3rd time trying this TGIF and it will be my last!
This Shit was nasty nd sampler was burnt strawberry daquari was watered down and fucking tasteless smfh wing ass niggaz

On a Thursday night, the place was pretty empty. There was no one at the front, and someone came and seated us shortly. I forgot our server's name.. I think it was Veronica. She was really nice and informative. We ordered boneless wings for appetizers which were really delicious. I was intrigued by the PB&J wings, which is exactly as it sounds! I got the balsamic caesar salad, which was pretty good. I feel like if the salad had a different type of lettuce, the salad would mix in better. Our waitress made me aware that the salad dressing was not the traditional creamy one, but it sure was good! The decor was really cool. I'm sure I will be back. Oh, and if you fill out a survey about your experience you can get $8 dollars off! I wish i kept the receipt...

Great environment great staff and the bartenders are amazing . They make you feel like home when you go . I like this Friday's because they offer mojitos as an option for happy hour which is good . The Long Island iced tea is amazing and very potent . Try the endless apps it's amazing and they let you switch between apps and stuff

Bad service , sat at the bar order a few drinks and mozzarella sticks. I have been eating at Friday's for years. As soon as I bite into the stick I knew they changed there recipe. I asked the waitress if Friday's changed there sticks, she said yes do you like them I said no there horrible. I asked if I can get another appetizer . She said no . Will never be back . Rather go to the one in cross county
Had an awesome time tonight at this store. Food was good and our service was outstanding. Our waitress was Amber. She knew what I wanted and needed before I did. I'd definitely go back!

Terrible service, horrible food.  Fried shrimp was cold, coke slaw was warm, cake w/pudding filling was frozen solid.  Waiter never checked back to make sure things were ok, and never offered drink refills.  Won't go back
I've been patronizing this location for many years, and so far it hasn't disappointed me. Most of the time there is little to no wait and for the most part the service is good.

This review is based on two separate visits. I first came here with my inlaws, and it was decent. It was a Saturday evening and we had no problem getting a table. Our waitress was nice and attentive throughout the majority of dinner. Unfortunately, the food wasn't so great. We ordered an appetizer sampler, which the mozz sticks and wings were okay, but the potato skins were dry and disgusting. The two steak dishes that were ordered tasted okay, but were not cooked to order (requested Rare and received Medium Well). I personally had the Smoke Stack burger which was pretty good, and my MIL seemed to like her pasta dish. However, the next day my grandmother-in-law had food poisoning and was in and out of the bathroom for the next 4 days. Since I had ordered one of the JumpBurger specials, my husband and I decided to come back for the free burger. We did the $10 appetizer (the boneless wings) and each ordered a burger. The wings - First batch was Parm Garlic - it was delicious! I would not hesitate to have anyone order those. Second batch took about 30 minutes to get after we requested - Sriracha Buffalo. It was spicy and pretty good as well. We decided to risk it and order a 3rd batch - again it took over 30 minutes to get. We tried the Memphis BBQ, which is nothing special. We took them home since we were waiting forever and got full. The burgers - the hubby ordered the Sicilian Burger, which had a lot of flavor and he really enjoyed. I had the Chorizo Burger, which wasn't as impressive flavor wise. Unfortunately, I also came down with a batch of food poisoning and was in the bathroom all night.  Our server was also very nice, but always disappeared. When we needed him we could never find him (for drink refills, or to put in our wing order, and none of our dirty plates were cleared until we asked for the check) Not sure what's going on at this location - I have frequented other Friday's and never had sub-par food or food poisoning. It seems like this place has it a lot. Since we got two more of the JumpBurger specials, I'll need to come back, but I hope I can find another location!

Great food and drinks. Mediocre service. You never know what you're going to get service wise but the food definitely doesn't disappoint. Endless $10 apps are back so that's a plus! Overall I give this restaurant 3 stars

Horrible! Dirty and cramped! We got sat at an end table 6 inches from another by the rude hostess, and bumped several times within seconds. Walked out with not even an apology from staff. Never again!

Every time I come here after work to relax and drink. I get Nicole as my bartender and she knows how to treat me and my friends. The Monday night happy hour is the one I like that most. They have great margaritas and mojitos. The appetizers are good too, I like the mozzarella sticks, buffalo wings, and stuffed jalapeños. If you're ever in the mode for a drink and a bite I recommend to here and ask for Nicole.

I'm literally sitting at my table still but NEEDED to write this review. I am 7 months pregnant and ordered the broccoli and cheddar soup for my meal, and what I got was a bowl of soup that was half broccoli and cheddar, half New England clam chowder. Obviously they took it off the bill but I can imagine two scenarios - either they emptied a bag of one of the soups into the other and served the entire restaurant this way, or there was a returned soup that someone in the kitchen filled up with the other soup and served me. Either way. Horrifying. Not coming back!

Me and my wife ordered burgers. Hers well done mine medium. When the waitress brought them to the table. I asked wch was well done ,she didn't know.  She took them back to the kitchen returned and asked who had the no pink burger so my wife said me and took the burger . I took the other. When I took a bite it was well done too.  The waitress came back and I asked her what she did when she went back there because both burgers are well done. She didn't know. She just kept saying ok ok ok and never tried to rectify the situation. Piss poor service.  PS the fries where cold and terrible  I would give it a 0 but there is no option I have to give it a 1
Food is not bad, but definitely could be better. Service sux. Food was late, cold, and no utensils. Next time, I would rather go to a diner for half the price. After all, won't come here again.
Place has been upgraded.  Looks nice.  Food and staff great.  And free dessert with Yelp review.

It's a chain so you pretty much know what you're in for. The food is pretty consistent and the service is normally good but it can be slow at times and it depends on who is helping you. I guess you can say that about any place but it is especially true here. Either way, the Yonkers Central Ave Fridays is my favorite Fridays location.

This Friday's establishment is ok. We happen to go today really early so it was not packed at all. Our waiter was very attentive and offered great service. The place is very clean and has a cool, calm ambiance. This is not my first time at this establishment and it definitely will not be the last. Loved the Sangria Berry today!

Had dinner with a friend here and it was great. We went around 8pm on a Tuesday and were seated immediately. Our orders were placed and came out very quickly. Our waitress was phenomenal. She continued to check on us and was very personable. She charged the wrong amounts on our cards but that was an understandable msitake since my friend and I went back and forth on amounts for a while. Besides that, I would definitely return to this location.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE! I would give this place -10 stars if I could!! Lets start off with when I went a few months back. The service was horrible, our waiter definitely seemed more focused on her cell phone then her job, had an attitude, wrote our whole order down wrong and then when we complained to the manager that everything came out wrong and mind you she forgot to put our appetizer in, she told the manager right in front of us that it was our fault, we were liars and told her exactly what she wrote And that we must just be trying to get her fired?!? Such a joke of a night! What would we get out of by lying about what we ordered? The whole experience was very frustrating due to her errors but apparently it was our fault and the manager didn't even do anything to compensate! I swore I would never go back!!  Until a few weeks ago, while out with my mother and baby, we decided to stop here on an early friday afternoon. The place was very empty maybe a handful of tables so I said whats the worst that can happen?! HAHA I JINXED IT THERE! We get seated, a waitress comes over and immediately asks what do we want to order! No introduction, not asking for drinks she wanted our entree! A little pushy! But ok, so I said to the woman I have a coupon, will I be able to use? She says "I have to see the coupon", as I look down on my phone to pull the coupon up and still speaking to her the whole time, I look up and realized she was gone! HOW RUDE?! How do you just walk away while your customer is talking to you?! Then to see she was at another table of 4 people, laughing and telling jokes that annoyed me! So I sat patiently and waited for her return, waited, waited and waited... Finally 10 minutes of not returning I decided to leave! THIS WOMAN NEVER CAME BACK! She finally walks right past us as we were about to walk out the door and never said a word cause she was rushing back to that other table!  Now after two horrible experiences all in recent time, I will definitely not be returning as I rather go else where and be happy all around!

By far the worst servers I have ever had. The tall Spanish female bartender was more worried about talking so her friends at bar the helping the rest of the people and after flagging her down she made nasty drinks. We order food that took a very long time and was cold the manager was nowhere around. Then when we did find the manager she never came back to the table

If I was able to give 0 stars i would. Walked into this place excited for the endless appetizers. from the moment we sat down the waitress was already giving us an attitude. Her first words were "you have no menus, the host is suppose to sit you down." (mind you, the host was the person who sat us there). She comes again to take our meals so we ask her what is included in the endless. Her exact response is, "its in the menu." By this time im laughing at how disgusted i am by the service at this place. after ordering and waiting 30 minutes for our food the waitress walks past and says, "you guys are still here ?" SHE DIDNT EVEN PLACE OUR ORDERS !!!! She switches with another waiter without even letting us know what happened. We walked out. They lost our business. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. DISGUSTED AND EMBARRASSED TO KNOW THEY HIRE JUST ANYONE IN THIS PLACE. NO WONDER CROSS COUNTY IS ALWAYS PACKED. WASTE OF TIME ! NEVER GOING BACK. GLAD TO KNOW WE WERENT ALONE. ALL THE REVIEWS HERE SEEM TO MATCH UP WITH MY EXPERIENCE.

Came in around 1030 on a sunday night and were seated promptly. It took quite a while for the waitress to come but we welcomed her when she did. She took our orders down and our starters came out pretty quick. When i went to look at the silverware it had some dirty brown stains on it. I know dishwashers leave water marks but i know the difference between watermarks and ungodly stains. My friend had the same issue on his so we asked for plastic.  Had the bbq flatbread chicken pizza as the starter and it was delicious. For an entree had the parmigian crusted chicken which came with parmigian covered mac and cheese which hit the spot. Everything was cooked well and the tastes were synchronized.  Some of my complaints would be the service. We had asked for like a minute to look over the menu but one minute turned to 10. Didn't come around to often after that and it took a while for us to get our check. Silverware was also pretty bad but you can always ask for plastic. Would come again, for the food that is.

I have been to this location 3 times during day hours between 1and 4pm and the third time was my last. The restaurant barely had 3 customers at the bar and the bartenders were gossiping and talking among themselves, martini glasses were filthy, food was cold and some of it missing, Spoke to Manager Jason and his attitude was absolutely  uncaring and horrible. He didnt even apologize or comp me for the negative experiences. I will never come here again, 3 strikes and your out. I will make sure that the corporate office hears the full details. DON'T GO HERE IF YOU EXPECT ANY TYPE OF GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Wow,  I have not been to TGI FRIDAYS in about a year and it's because the service is that bad.   Today,  I was reminded why I do not go there anymore.  It was 4 adults and 2 children and we were seated very quickly.   The restaurant was not crowded at all and it took the 30 minutes to get our drinks.   We ordered appetizers and those came before the drinks.   The endless appetizers menu we ordered from continuously came out cold.   The drinks were watered down and the kids chocolate milk took 20 minutes to arrive!!!???  My son's was complaining that his stomach was hurting after he ate just one kids burger slider.  I will honestly never go back to another TGI FRIDAYS EVEN IF THEY GIVE ME THE FOOD FOR FREE!

Ugh if I could but zero stars I would! It's ghetto, dirty and the waiters are so unprofessional, they don't even know about the items on the menu. The food tastes like reheated frozen food too. Sorry TGIF but I'll pass.

Shaking my head ! Just left this restaurant and all I could say is HORRIBLE ! We waited 20mins just for someone to come to the table just to inform us that he isn't the server. Thank GOD their is a higher power above that was looking down at us this night and had this guy start us off with drinks and apps. After that we waiting another 10mins just to get our drinks and another 20mins for SPINACH DIP , yes only dip. Waiting all this time for drinks and apps you would think the restaurant was busy right ? Well you thought wrong , it was literally 6 tables INCLUDING us. I advise everyone to stay away , don't waste money or time at this place it's not worth it. Overall the food was okay nothing special to make me come back , my only piece of advice is fire the staff save the establishment. . no not even that Friday's need to close this location down and do a favor for the community!

I often go here for happy hour and I love all the bartenders John is always attentive and makes great drinks. The only reason why I'm not giving 5 stars is because honestly the waiter and waitresses aren't that great it's like they can't smile but I would deff recommend happy hour!

This location needs help. Some of the waiters are very nice and welcoming while others are just plain rude. Living in the area, my family usually orders take out from here. 7 out of 10 times they mess up the orders in some way and we have to spend more time waiting, which really bugs me. I rarely dine in but the last time I did the waiter was super distracted and food took a while to come out. The food is good so I will still order from here but the staff needs some working on.

Talk about an entire family getting sick right after having dinner at this place. We got there for dinner about 9:30. Really not an excuse to get served old food. My two kids had diarrhea for 2 days after eating their disgusting mac and cheese. I ordered an steak that probably had been sitting on their grill for about 2 hrs before being served to me. All of us had very bad experience and stomach ache. To top the unpleasant experience after reaching out to them , never hear a word from management.

Great place to stop in grab apps with their special on apps before catching a movie or grab a bite to eat for the night. Bacon wrapped jalapeno were great wish they were spicier. Mahi mahi was good  it was my first time having mahi mahi and I will definitely order again. and California chicken wrap was good. Waiter was quick . But pen fell off the table he saw but kept walking so we had to pick it up. Overall good experience since we were trying to catch a movie and just stopped for quick meal . Was pleasantly surprised. But will say wait staff if sitting down for an actual nice meal not rushing somewhere was quick abrupt and hardly asked how everything was.

I rarely, rarely bother to review a meal. i eat out 3x a week on average. i decided to write a review on this joint only b/c the following reasons: 1. the prices are too high for drinks. $11 on a margarita that is served in a small glass? no more than 4oz of liquid, immersed in tons of ice. WTF? 2. all the cocktails are unlisted for pricing on the drink menu. you have to ask the server what the prices are. 3. the servers carry this stupid tablet computer everywhere. our server never bothered to look into my eyes every time he shows with a question, a plate of food, or anything. i'm not too bothered by it, perhaps he is too focused on his stupid tablet. but the manager ought to teach his/her servers to make eye contacts. 4. the bruschetti chicken pasta i ordered was bone dry. overcooked piece of chicken meat. not good.  5. prices for all the food were just too pricey. if it was expensive for a quality meal, i wouldn't bother. but even after some mail coupons (one entree free), the bill was still way too high.  not coming back, ever!

I have visited this TGI Fridays location about once a week for the last several weeks. I usually go during lunch hours with someone and we always leave satisfied. Dwayne has been our waiter each and every time. He's great. Attentive and informative. He makes great recommendations and suggested I download the Fridays app. I'm so glad I did! I get deals and rewards on a regular basis which is on top of their already decent prices (especially lunch).  The food is pretty average on Mondays but at least it's not bad. Every other day of the week I've went, the food has been served hot and tasty!!! The Jack Daniels options and the endless apps are my favorite. They have a wide assortment of beverages. The alcoholic drinks seemed a bit watered down but I didn't mind.  The space is usually clean and there is a lot of seating. I invited a group of friends once and they had such a good time and loved the food and prices that we've decided to make it our regular hangout spot!

This place was great a few times before I went tonight and I order the pecan salad and it's was gross the chicken look like it's been sitting in the fridge for months cold and the salad was drench in dressing could not enjoy it all appetizer came with the food so had to eat both at the same time bad service

Good service. Very impressed. The staff was friendly and professional. You don't see that often, especially chain restaurants. I ordered the unlimited appetizers and my plate was never empty. Awesome! I was completely stuffed. Also ordered the strawberry lemonade and it was really yummy. They even muddled actual strawberries.

Food was horrible... they got the order wrong once we sent the food back it was another 25 minutes till we got food and it was dry as hell... food horrible... waiter was great and then the manager to very good care of us!!

I went to TGIF on March 4th for my 21st Birthday with my twin sister and 25 coworkers. I called on the Thursday prior to , to see if I could reserve a table which we had reserved back in December when we had a goodbye celebration for our former manager. I work down the road and we always come to TGIF every Friday. There was a small misunderstanding with times so our table was given away, but not to worry the General Manager made everything work out and got a table together for us right behind the bar. Everyone was happy, especially since we had .THE BEST OF THE BEST OMARI ! He assisted us last Thursday at the bar and he is the multi tasking KING. He handles a large and loud crowd very professionally. He is a great listener and apparently can memorize all orders. He has a great attitude and he treated us fantastic. He is a respectable worker and assest to TGIF and I hope it is recognized by all his managers and coworkers. We will always go to see Omari when we visit TGIF. Also another huge thank you to the General Manager who has arranged everything for us twice with our large crowd. We really appreciate it and always enjoy a night at TGIF. 100% Satisfied, you deserve your 5 stars. Last but not least, the front staff when we arrived we welcoming and understanding. Nobody looked out of place of unprofessional. If I had a question, they were ready to answer. I am a Stylist at David's Bridal in Yonkers just down the road and I know what it is to give and recieve high quality customer service. I understand the importance of reviews and to give credit where credit it due. THANK YOU SO MUCH OMARI, MANAGER, AND STAFF.

As a rule, I generally avoid chain restaurants. My last experience at Friday's reminded me why. It was a Saturday night and we were a large group of 7. We were in the area and had not made any reservations. Friday's had no trouble giving us a table without a wait.  Call me cynical, but in retrospect perhaps that should have been my first warning.  We were seated at a table without any utensils or place settings. We all ordered, some of us opting for 1 or 2 appetizers as our main course instead of an entree. After a short wait, a server brought the "appetizer" selections only. Service 101 would be to serve everyone at the same time, since we had ordered the appetizers as our main course, but I let it slide since they were from the appetizer menu. Maybe they thought we were planning to share. I'd typically wait for everyone to be served before I start eating, but, not wanting the food to get cold, those of us who had ordered appetizers began to eat. Halfway through, we began searching for napkins, because they had still never brought us any. We reached over and took utensils from the table next to us. My friend ordered an iced tea and was brought a coke. 2 of us ordered water. The waitress brought me my glass and then set another one down on the table saying, "I brought an extra glass of water in case anyone wants." "I guess she forgot I ordered water too," my friend murmured once she'd walked away.  As the "appetizer course" finished, a server came back and dropped off 2 sandwiches and an order of fries that had been forgotten in the appetizer round. We were still waiting for 2 meals. By the time the 2 that got their meals were almost finished with their sandwiches, the other 2 still had not made an appearance. We flagged down our waitress and pointed it out to her. After scanning the table to verify that no, we had not hidden 2 burgers somewhere, she went off in search of the missing meals. We confirmed that we were missing a regular burger and a black bean burger. A server came by a few minutes later offering a chicken sandwich. We were missing 2 burgers so we shook our heads and he went off to ask every other table if they had ordered a chicken sandwich. After making the rounds, he came back to us. "Are you sure you didn't order a chicken sandwich?"  We had, but that meal had arrived during course #2. We were missing 2 burgers. Our waitress came back for another consult. A few more minutes passed and finally, one of the burgers came out. Everyone else had finished their meals by this point. My friend began eating her burger. The black bean burger was still no where in site.  Really, the place was not that crowded and it wasn't even a meat burger. Were they growing the vegetables back there?  We asked again. Once the last burger was almost finished we found the manager.  At one point, our waitress started towards us, saw him still sitting there without a meal and turned and walked away without coming to the table. My friend with the burger had finished already when the manager came to the table with the black bean burger. Her apology, "Don't shoot the messenger. I have your burger.  Sorry for the wait."  We hadn't even said anything as she approached, but really, that's your apology?  We had been in the restaurant for over 2 hours at this point and this guy had sat there patiently, without complaining, watching everyone else eat in 3 separate rounds.  In their defense, they did end up comping the 2 burgers. I still will never be back and would recommend you avoid unless you are not very hungry, hate good service, and have a few hours to kill waiting.

horrible! horrible! horrible! management waiters servers all horrible! today is august 8, 2017 my son 15th birthday! ive been coming to this fridays since he was 7!  never again never have i been told i have to " pay for a desert " in order to be sung happy birthday! where?! in what fridays do you have to pay for a slice of cake to get happy birthday sang?! ive been coming to this fridays since my son turnt 7! i was given a cup of whipped cream with a cherry on top with the most dreadful happy birthday song ever! i spent $86.75 plus tip! im highly upset and will not be returning!!!

This place was great!! Very clean and organized.  We were greeted as soon as we walked in the door. My drink was A+. We had appetizers to start. They came out quick and was hot and fresh. My son had the Jack chicken and shrimp. He devoured it. It was cooked to perfection. This was worth the ride here. I stopped at the one on Kimbal Avenue first.  That place needs to close. I will definitely come back here again.  Jose is phenomenal. Give this guy a raise!!!!

Service was trash and when I say trash I mean trash waited 20 minutes for my endless apps and the server was gone. Houdini himself could appear faster then our waiter. 40 minutes pass and I finally order my second app and what do you know. HES GONE AGAIN. I really spent 12 buckaroos for 2 apps, TWO APPS, I'm good fam lil b where you at

This location is the worst one in the area. Hoping to avoid the busy hours, we went here on a weeknight after 7pm. Had to wait in the seating area for someone to seat us although the place was pretty empty. We were seated in a booth (no problem), with sticky floors (yuck) and told a someone (names aren't important) would be over to take your order. Since this booth was near the kitchen, we could hear most of the staff while we waited. Waited for water that never came and neither did anyone to take our order in a nearly empty restaurant. The greeter that seated us was still in the kitchen with everyone else, so after 23 minutes of being ignored, we left. I was hangry and refused to wait another moment.
I loved it. I came here for the unlimited appetizers and their selection was great and definitely good deal. I recommend the wings and the mozzarella sticks.

Short version: Only come here if you want to feel like it's a Monday. Went there for endless appetizers, received endless wait time AFTER being seated at our table. We weren't assigned a waiter, but that's okay, because we BECAME the waiters.  Long version: Came here on a Friday evening because 2 members of our group like Fridays, and it wasn't busy inside at all. We we promptly seated, followed by receiving no attention at all. After a lengthy and unacceptable period of time, we left. And we DID wait long, because I was looking forward to the "Really Good Cheeseburger". They didn't even ask what was wrong when they saw us walk out. Felt pretty disrespected.  We proceeded next door to Pizza & Brew, where it was more crowded but we were promptly served. So problem solved, don't go to this Friday's if you want service.  Sorry, can't give a good review if we receive no service at all.
Very nice place the problem is the service is terrible and the food I don't back again any more .

Horrible horrible, my son had Mac & cheese said it was ok , husband liked his ribs but nothing to rave about, I had the 15$ unlimited apps. Well the waiter forgot to tell me it's 1 dish at a time my family was done eating and I had 2 appetizers, I was starving, when I confronted the waiter he said that's the repercussion , I ordered a burger the after waiting another 10 minutes I cancelled and go the check, 0 money for a tip nasty waiter and so unprofessional

If i could give it a 0 star for service i would. Horrable service. They serve me my food. No utensils. No plates. Took me 10 minutes to get it. Waiters here need more training!!! What kind of restaurant does this?! Go eat in another fridays. This place has horrible service.
Take out order- food was terrible, over cooked, dry... and looked it.  Big waste of money & bigger disappointment. Never again. Don't waste your time. Go to the diner...

I'm very dissatisfied with the level of customer service that I received at this location tonight. I regularly visited this location 4 to 5 times a week and sometimes even twice in one day. I can honestly say that I enjoyed myself and had a friendly rapport with the bartenders, they always have a great and upbeat attitude. John, Omarion,Ralph and Johnathon have always gone above and beyond on ensuring that myself ( and whatever guest I brought ) had a great time. Its upsetting that it was the managers on duty that dropped the ball. I ordered an app ( boneless wings) and a burger. Like I stated earlier I'm not fussy at all. The burger came out first and BURNED.. I understand that maybe that burger doesn't take long to cook, but for it to come out charred and hard that's unacceptable. I pointed it out to the bartender on duty and he agreed and took it back to tell the kitchen to remake another one. At that time my APPETIZER came out, that's when I decided not to take the new burger because it's not the first time that I have had an issue with my food, whether it came out STALE, UNDERCOOKED and or OVERCOOKED not Per my request. You would imagine that the managers would take time out of their "BUSY" shift to come over and apologize for the quality of the food . A small apology would've diffused the situation,but The managers decided to sit down in a booth behind me just to chat, I guess cause they were exhausted from cooking ( I noticed one of them cooking ). I'm not looking for anything I just want people to be aware of how they treat unsatisfied guest. This isn't the first time I have had an issue with the food and managers. So I left hungry and upset. I'll guess I'll take my small 150 dollars that I spend there a week elsewhere.
